definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: Beauty fit to ornament those ancient manors.
sentences.chinese: 適於裝飾那些古老的莊園的美人。

sentences.english: He jazzed up the room with some bright red curtains.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些鮮紅的窗簾將房間裝飾得更具生氣。

sentences.english: The sweater is ornamented with jeweled embroideries.
sentences.chinese: 這件毛衣用鑲寶石的刺繡作裝飾。

sentences.english: Those are only our decoration, coz we never follow the money.
sentences.chinese: 那只是偶們的裝飾品，偶們從來不會被錢奴役。

sentences.english: I use them September through December.
sentences.chinese: 從九月到十二月，都可以用木珠來裝飾房間。

sentences.english: His hall was decorated with deer horns.
sentences.chinese: 他的大廳用鹿角裝飾着。

sentences.english: The crown is decorated with a stunning black onyx cabochon.
sentences.chinese: 錶冠以一顆華麗的凸圓形黑縞瑪瑙裝飾。

sentences.english: I spend quite some time and energy decorating my room.
sentences.chinese: 我花了不少時間和精力裝飾我的房間。

sentences.english: Semi-precious stones were used for inlay ornamentation.
sentences.chinese: 準寶石的石頭用來做鑲嵌裝飾。

sentences.english: Blue Allover is the most representative daily article and decorating article in the area South of Yangtze River.
sentences.chinese: 藍印花布是江南最有代表性的生活用品和裝飾用品。

sentences.english: This fact must be useful for glass coated application industry.
sentences.chinese: 這個結論可應用到玻璃裝飾業上。

sentences.english: We've decorated the Christmas tree with plenty of tinsel and baubles.
sentences.chinese: 我們用很多亮亮的東西和小玩意來裝飾聖誕樹。

sentences.english: They’ll make the invitations, hang the decorations, and even serve the food.
sentences.chinese: 他們將會發邀請函，佈置裝飾品，和甚至提供食物。

sentences.english: The extracted oriental and occidental essence is embodied by a combination of undecorated quality and fashionable elements.
sentences.chinese: 提煉中西精華，不經裝飾的特質與時尚元素相結合。

sentences.english: Decorate to burnish from model lines, had had the change of thoroughly remould oneself.
sentences.chinese: 從造型線條到打磨裝飾，已經有了脫胎換骨的變化。

sentences.english: It is the perfection and the supreme adornment of the justified soul.
sentences.chinese: 這是完善和最高人民法院裝飾品的理由靈魂。

definition: to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
exterior appearance/to view sth from the outside/exterior condition
